This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=CENSUS-UK.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-18T14:26:54Z Gillian Meadows 2015-02-18T14:22:41+00:00 2015-02-18T14:22:41+00:00 Reminder: CALL FOR PAPERS: Census Applications: Using the UK\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds population census data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;2c4660b.1502 [cid:image001.gif@01D0366F.9BE8A810]<br>UK Data Service, Census Support<br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br>Census Applications: Using the UK’s population census data<br>University of Manchester<br>16 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 17 July 2015<br>Now that nearly all census outputs are out and being used the UK Data Service are hosting a two day conference to celebrate the UK censuses.<br>We are seeking offers of papers on both analysis and methods.<br>Census methods include policy issues, statistical principles and technological innovation relating to census design, output and dissemination as well as statistical approaches to analysing the final products. We are keen to hear from data producers, distributors and methodologists.<br> [...] Gillian Meadows 2015-01-26T14:15:36+00:00 2015-01-26T14:15:36+00:00 CALL FOR PAPERS: Census Applications: Using the UK\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds population census data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;416adb70.1501 [cid:image001.gif@01D0366F.9BE8A810]<br>UK Data Service, Census Support<br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br>Census Applications: Using the UK’s population census data<br>University of Manchester<br>16 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 17 July 2015<br>Now that nearly all census outputs are out and being used the UK Data Service are hosting a two day conference to celebrate the UK censuses.<br>We are seeking offers of papers on both analysis and methods.<br>Census methods include policy issues, statistical principles and technological innovation relating to census design, output and dissemination as well as statistical approaches to analysing the final products. We are keen to hear from data producers, distributors and methodologists.<br> [...] Gillian Meadows 2015-01-23T08:34:00+00:00 2015-01-23T08:34:00+00:00 Workshop: 2011 Census - aggregate data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;8390b351.1501 Interested in what the 2011 census can tell you about the population within countries or smaller areas? Join us for an introductory hands-on workshop to using standard census outputs from the 2011 Census.<br><br>Workshop: 2011 Census - aggregate data<br><br>17 February 2015, 1 - 4pm<br>Room 4.2, Roscoe Building, University of Manchester<br>The most widely used form of outputs from UK Censuses are based on counts. These counts tell us how many people (or households) have particular characteristics within a given area. These data are widely used to understand the characteristics of areas, including small areas. Because they refer to [...] Samantha Cockings 2015-01-09T17:49:02+00:00 2015-01-09T17:49:02+00:00 Call for papers: CEUS Special Issue - Spatial analysis with census data: emerging issues and innovative approaches https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;5658fda4.1501 Call for Papers<br>Special Issue of Computers, Environment and Urban Systems on:<br><br>Spatial analysis with census data: emerging issues and innovative approaches<br><br>In many countries data systems that have been in place for the better part of a century have started to change. Census data are still the major source for geographically detailed estimates of populations and economies. However, the national/state agencies that produce this data are increasingly under financial and political pressures to produce more accurate and more frequent estimates while survey response rates continue to decline and the cost of conducting surveys increases. In some countries there is [...] Gillian Meadows 2015-01-07T09:59:17+00:00 2015-01-07T09:59:17+00:00 Booking now open - UK Data Service Census Support workshops: aggregate data and flow data https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;59385c4c.1501 Booking is now open for the following workshops:<br><br>Workshop: 2011 Census - flow data<br><br>16 February 2015, 2 - 5pm<br>Bedford Way G11, University College London<br><br>The flow data from UK censuses are used to track movements between two geographies; home and work, origin and destination, or first and second residence. Data from the 2011 Census are now becoming available in open and safeguarded format and are expected to be of much higher quality than 2001 data. [...] Gillian Meadows 2014-12-09T11:15:45+00:00 2014-12-09T11:15:45+00:00 UK Data Service rolling programme of webinars https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;79817d44.1412 From January, the UK Data Service will be rolling out a programme of 26 regular webinars throughout the year. These will cover a collection of 14 core topics. A flyer listing the topics and dates is available at http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/media/455322/core-webinars-2015.pdf.<br>Webinars are online seminars which are free and easy to join without the expense and trouble of travel any further than to your own computer.<br>To book or to find out more about our wider programme of outreach and training events including our specialist and one-off webinars please go to ukdataservice.ac.uk/news-and-events<br>Join us online in January: [...] Gillian Meadows 2014-11-13T15:53:16+00:00 2014-11-13T15:53:16+00:00 Book now: UK Data Service Census Support webinars https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;6d122296.1411 Booking is now open for the following free webinars.<br><br>2011 Census: Flow Data<br><br>4 December 2014<br>Online at 3pm<br><br>This webinar provides an overview of the interaction data available as outputs from the 2011 Census. Interaction data are about flows between two places, such as counts of migrants or commuters.<br><br>It will describe what data are available, including data deriving from new questions in the 2011 Census, and how they can be accessed using online tools. [...] Gillian Meadows 2014-10-14T11:16:26+00:00 2014-10-14T11:16:26+00:00 Two forthcoming BSPS day meetings open to non-members and free https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;2ad0d57a.1410 List members may be interested in the following events:<br><br>1) A BSPS day meeting on 'usual residence' and alternative population bases, at London School of Economics on Friday 24th October 2014, 10.30am-5.00pm.<br><br>This meeting on population bases for presenting census and related stats will take place at LSE on Friday 24 October, 10.30am-5pm. The programme for the day is now finalised (see attached pdf). Register by emailing pic@lse.ac.uk<mailto:pic@lse.ac.uk> or phoning the BSPS Secretariat on 020 7955 7666. There is no charge for this meeting and it is open to members and non-members. [...] Paul Norman 2014-10-06T14:54:58+01:00 2014-10-06T14:54:58+01:00 Second Call for Papers: GIS Research UK (GISRUK) 2015. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;c553a4df.1410 N.B. Population geographers ... GISRUK is not all about techy GIS!! Stuff that you would do at RGS-IBG or BSPS might well be appropriate (if you throw in a map!!).<br><br>Apologies for cross posting ...<br><br>Second Call for Papers: GIS Research UK (GISRUK) 2015.<br><br>School of Geography, University of Leeds, UK<br><br>15-17 April, 2015 [...] Gillian Meadows 2014-09-22T09:11:22+00:00 2014-09-22T09:11:22+00:00 Book now: Census Research User Conference and Enhancing and Enriching Historic Census Microdata Event https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;f15eeb34.1409 Census Research User Conference<br><br>31 October 2014, 9.15am - 4pm<br>Royal Statistical Society, London<br><br>This one-day conference, organised by UK Data Service Census Support, will be an opportunity for data producers and research users of the census to gather to discuss data developments, research undertaken and work in progress. The day will be composed of presentations from census agencies on developments in data and from users who have used the data in their research. The presentations will be based on analysis of the 2011 and earlier census products. [...] Cozzolino, Susan 2014-09-03T14:41:05+00:00 2014-09-03T14:41:05+00:00 Call for papers: British Society for Population Studies meeting, 24 October, London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;93b6459.1409 A BSPS day meeting on 'usual residence' and alternative population bases: call for papers and opportunity to register<br><br>This forthcoming meeting will be held at LSE on Friday 24th October 2014, 10.30am-5.00pm.<br><br>The main question to be addressed is: 'Is the concept of 'usual residence' reaching its sell-by date?' Now that the Government has confirmed that a further Population Census will take place in 2021, it is an opportune time to consider how far the use of alternative population bases should be expanded at the expense of statistics based on usual residence. [...] Gillian Meadows 2014-08-19T08:16:45+00:00 2014-08-19T08:16:45+00:00 Call for papers - Census Research User Conference 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;c46d30ee.1408 Call for papers - Census Research User Conference 2014<br><br>Friday 31 October 2014<br><br>Royal Statistical Society, 12 Errol Street, London, EC1Y 8LX<br><br>This one-day conference will provide users and data creators with an opportunity to meet and discuss developments in census research. The day will be composed of presentations from census agencies on developments in data and from users who have used the data in their research. [...] Cozzolino, Susan 2014-07-30T09:32:19+00:00 2014-07-30T09:32:19+00:00 Future of the UK Census https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;dfa8747c.1407 Future of the UK Census: Government welcomes online survey for 2021<br><br>The UK Government has officially responded to the recommendations of the National Statistician for providing future population statistics for England and Wales.<br><br>The recommendations, forwarded in March 2014, called for a predominantly online census in 2021 supplemented by further use of administrative and survey data. [...] Martin D.J. 2014-07-29T15:12:22+00:00 2014-07-29T15:12:22+00:00 FW: The Government's response to the National Statistician's recommendation https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CENSUS-UK;82c07e9b.1407 An important development of interest to all Census users...<br><br>From: Tracy Robinson [mailto:tracy.robinson@ons.gsi.gov.uk] On Behalf Of Beyond2011@ons.gsi.gov.uk<br>Sent: 29 July 2014 16:07<br>To: Beyond2011<br>Subject: The Government's response to the National Statistician's recommendation<br><br>Dear census user<br><br>You may recall that the National Statistician made a recommendation on 27 March 2014 about the census and future provision of population statistics in England and Wales. [...]
